intro: Diasperus sundaicus, commonly known as the Sunda Diasperus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
